quest.name: The Binding Soil
journal:
Muna Vanu is watching Ranu Vali sow seeds with little success.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

Muna Vanu comments that Ranu Vali looks frustrated when she sows her seeds. When he offered to help her, she apparently asked for your help instead. Speak with Ranu Vali about how you can assist in the village's tilling.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Ranu Vali laments the pitiful soil on their new home and has her doubts whether the island can sustain itself by growing crops in the sandy dirt. Fondly recalling the richness of the soil around her former village, she asks you to return to retrieve some sackfuls to be used on Ok' Gundu Nakki, as well as some fire-touched wind crystals to treat the existing soil.
You have retrieved three sackfuls of soil from the Gundu village and a handful of fire-touched wind crystals. Return to Ok' Gundu Nakki to deliver the items to Ranu Vali.

You have handed over the items to Ranu Vali, who holds her ancestors' chosen soil with delight. With the right nutrients and a helping of wind crystals, Ranu Vali claims the earth of Ok' Gundu Nakki will soon bear delicious fruit for all.
objectives: Deliver the sacks of soft soil and the fire-touched wind crystals to Ranu Vali.

dialogue.name: MUNAVANU
dialogue.text: Greetings, netherling. Muna Vanu is concerned about Ranu Vali, who prepares the land for crops. He often sees her with ruffled feathers as she sows seeds, but no juicy bounties of fruit.

dialogue.name: MUNAVANU
dialogue.text: Muna offers to help her, but she asks for netherling's assistance instead. Maybe netherling helps sow seeds, too?

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Ranu Vali is glad netherling came. There is lots to do and scarce to work with for preparing village land for tilling. As of this sun, earth of Ok' Gundu Nakki is dry as dhalmel bones, impossible to grow crops.

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: See here? How it blows away like dust in breeze? Ranu tries sowing and sowing, but soil is not favorable for almonds, or lemons, or even sanuwa relief patch!

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Even so, Ranu still has hope, remembers soil of old village. Very rich for tilling, very reason why ancestors settle on that spot. If netherling brings ancestors' chosen soil to Ok' Gundu Nakki, Ranu is certain that village grows sweetest lemons in Sea of Clouds!

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: But chosen soil alone will not bear fruit! Wind crystals of Last Step, those touched by fire are also very important for treating barren soil. Might netherling bring those as well? Ranu is very grateful in advance, like dry plains awaiting approaching rainstorm.

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Wind crystals must be able to balance right amount of soil. Three wind crystals good for about three sackfuls of Gundu soil. Ranu Vali is counting on netherling!

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Was netherling able to find ancestral soil and wind crystals? Ranu can feel sowing season drawing near on breeze...

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Yes, ancestors' chosen soil smells exactly as Ranu remembers as nestling! Feels so soft and moist as fresh spring shower!

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Ranu Vali was worried about leaving Ok' Gundu soil far behind. Dry, dusty land of Ok' Gundu Nakki felt foreign under her feet. But thanks to netherling, little piece of former village returns and island will truly feel like Gundu land!

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Now real work begins! Ranu must treat dry Ok' Gundu Nakki soil with wind crystals, then mix fertile earth from old Gundu village into crop patch, so two homes become one.

dialogue.name: RANUVALI
dialogue.text: Hmmm...it will take a while to sow seeds. Gundu and netherling must wait patiently. But when juicy fruit ready for harvest, taste moves herhim like mountain!
